discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
By associating a domain with EPG-12 that includes VLAN-1212 in its VLAN pool, you ensure that traffic from SVR-12 is properly encapsulated and mapped within the ACI fabric.

questions.question_text: An engineer configures port-12 on Leaf-101 and Leaf-102 to connect to a new server. SVR-12. The new server will belong to EPG-12 and use encap VLAN-1212. The engineer configured port-12 as a VPC member port and statically bound the VPC member port to EPG-12. Which additional step must the engineer take to configure connectivity?

choices.D: Associate a domain with EPG-12 that is associated with VLAN-1212.
choices.C: Select VLAN-1212 on the EPG-12 Interface Policy Group.
choices.A: Create a VPC Explicit Protection Group for EPG-12 and VLAN-1212.
choices.B: Configure an LACP Interface Policy and apply it to EPG-12.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
In a Cisco ACI fabric, silent hosts (e.g., App_2 on S2) are endpoints that do not proactively send traffic (such as Gratuitous ARP) and therefore are not automatically learned by the ACI fabric. To force the fabric to learn a silent host, you need to ensure that the host receives traffic that prompts it to respond, revealing its MAC and IP addresses. The correct Bridge Domain (BD) configuration to achieve this is setting "L2 Unknown Unicast" to "Flood".

choices.B: Set L2 Unknown Unicast to Flood.
choices.C: Set L3 Unknown Multicast to Optimized flood.
choices.A: Set Unicast Routing to Hardware Proxy.

questions.question_text:
A Cisco ACI fabric has three different endpoints S1, S2, and S3. These endpoints must communicate with each other without contracts. These objects have been created in APIC:

• Two EPGs named DNS_EPG and Database_EPG
• Two application profiles. PROD_App and Data_App
• Two bridge domains DNS_BD and Database_BD
• PROD_APP and Database_BD mapped to Tenant PROD
• Data_App and DNS_BD mapped to Tenant Data

Which set of actions completes the fabric configuration?

choices.B:
Add S1, S2, S3, under DNS_EPG.
MAP DNS_EPG to Data_App.
Associate DNS_EPG with Dns_BD.
choices.A:
Add S1, S2, S3 under Database_EPG.
MAP Database_EPG under PROD_ App.
Associate Datbase_EPG with DNS_BD.
choices.C:
Add S1, S2, S3 under DNS_EPG.
MAP DNS_EPG to Data_App.
Associate DNS_EPG with Database_BD.
choices.D:
Add S1, S2, S3 under Database_EPG.
MAP Database_EPG under Data_App.
Associate Datbase_EPG with Database_BD.
Spines use BGP peering with IPN to send out the TEP pool prefix for the local pod.
choices.A: It manages the configuration of different Cisco ACI pods using a single common Cisco APIC cluster.
choices.C: A VPNv4 address family is used to exchange endpoint information between spines.
choices.B: It eliminates the need to deploy multicast in the Layer 3 network that interconnects the pods.

questions.question_text: What is a characteristic of a Cisco ACI Multi-Pod?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
In a Cisco ACI Multi-Pod architecture, multiple pods (each with its own leaf-and-spine topology) are interconnected via an Inter-Pod Network (IPN). The key characteristic of the Multi-Pod setup is that it is managed as a single fabric by a single APIC cluster, simplifying operations and maintaining consistency across all pods.

questions.question_text: An engineer is creating a configuration import policy that must terminate if the imported configuration is incompatible with the existing system. Which import mode achieves this result?

discussion.content:
Atomic is correct..

Ref: 
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/datacenter/aci/apic/sw/4-x/basic-configuration/Cisco-APIC-Basic-Configuration-Guide-42x/Cisco-APIC-Basic-Configuration-Guide-42x_chapter_0100.html


importMode

 Best-effort mode: each MO is applied individually, and errors only cause the invalid MOs to be skipped.
 Note 
 If the object is not present on the controller, none of the children of the object get configured. Best-effort mode attempts to configure the children of the object.

 Atomic mode: configuration is applied by whole shards. A single error causes whole shard to be rolled back to its original state.

B is correct:

Atomic—ignores shards that contain objects that cannot be imported while proceeding with shards that can be imported. If the version of the incoming configuration is incompatible with the existing system, the import terminates.

Selected Answer: B
B right answer.

Selected Answer: B
Atomic—ignores shards that contain objects that cannot be imported while proceeding with shards that can be imported. If the version of the incoming configuration is incompatible with the existing system, the import terminates

Best-effort—ignores objects within a shard that cannot be imported. If the version of the incoming configuration is incompatible with the existing system, shards that are incompatible are not be imported while the import proceeds with those that can be imported.

Atomic Replace—overwrites existing configuration with imported configuration data. Any objects in the existing configuration that do not exist in the imported configuration are deleted.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/datacenter/aci/apic/sw/4-x/aci-fundamentals/Cisco-ACI-Fundamentals-401/Cisco-ACI-Fundamentals-401_chapter_01011.html
Any new exam takers? Is this still valid? I heard that Cisco Data Center certification is getting some revisions.
Atomic is correct : Merge and replace are Import Types not import Modes
